text:
SUPERNATURAL: Witch doctors in Papua were eaten to transfer their "powers" 
PAPUA NEW GUINEA 
Cannibalism has been reported on the Pacific island of Papua New Guinea as recently as 2012. 
Almost 30 alleged man-eaters were charged with being members of a bloodthirsty cult who murdered seven "witch doctors". 
The suspects were accused of eating their victims' brains RAW and making soup out of their penises in a bizarre bid to transfer their supernatural powers and become "bullet proof". 
In the same year Brit tourist Matthew Iovane and American girlfriend Michelle Clemens told how they were kidnapped, stripped beaten and blindfolded by "cannibal" jungle tribesmen in Papua. 
GETTY DEATH IN PARADISE: Tourist Stefan Ramin was reportedly eaten in Nuku Hiva 
GETTY JAILED: Arihano Haiti was convicted of Stefan Ramin's murder in French Polynesia 
FRENCH POLYNESIA 
A German tourist is believed to have been eaten by an alleged cannibal after he went missing on the remote tropical paradise Island Nuku Hiva. 
Cops searching for Stefan Ramin raised the alarm after finding charred human remains and clothes close to an abandoned camp fire. 
Tour guide Arihano Haiti was found guilty of his killing and jailed for 28 years in 2014. 
But outraged islanders denied the practice was widespread, insisting: "We prefer hot dogs to people." 
DEMOCRATIC REPUBLIC OF CONGO 
Violent thugs stoned a man to death before burning and eating him in the belief he was part of a Ugandan Islamist rebel group operating in the DRC, according to 2014 reports. 
In 2003 UN officials probed grisly claims that cannibal Congolese rebels from the Ituri province were capturing and butchering pygmies before feeding on their sexual organs. 
And victims were also forced to eat the remains of their colleagues, it was alleged. 
UGANDA 
Four men were reportedly caught red-handed boiling a human head in the tiny village of Kiboga last November. 
The gruesome news comes as Dominic Ongwen, a former commander of the notorious Lord's Resistance Army, faces trial at The Hague for allegedly ordering his men to kill, cook and eat civilians. 
Ongwen, a former child soldier who rose through the ranks of Joseph Kony's infamous Ugandan rebel faction, denies war crimes and insists he was a victim of the atrocities. 
GETTY ON TRIAL: Child soldier turned warlord Dominic Ongwen pictured at the Hague 
LIBERIA 
Former Liberian warlord Joshua Milton Blahyi – aka General Butt Naked – reportedly admitted using human sacrifice and cannibalism in Liberia during the 90s to gain magical powers. 
Blahyi – dubbed the most evil man in the world, who charged into battle completely starkers - revealed how he claimed 20,000 lives in his ruthless quest for blood. 
The reformed rebel commander - who has since turned to Christ and become a pastor – revealed how he ripped out and ate children's HEARTS in a 2008 interview. 
Meanwhile former Liberian President Charles Taylor was jailed for war crimes in 2011 after being accused of ordering troops to consume the flesh of enemies and UN soldiers during warfare with Sierra Leone. 
One prosecution witness testified how they slit victims' throats and butchered them, adding: "(we) throw away the head, take the flesh ad put it in the pot… Charles Taylor knows that." 
Cannibalism and ritual sacrifice is said to continue to cast a shadow over the country. 
GETTY REMAINS: Skulls and bones found at the Killing Fields in Cambodia 
CAMBODIA 
Troops fighting in the savage Khmer Rouge regime during the 1970s reportedly cut out prisoners livers before cooking and eating them. 
And survivors of the sickening "Killing Fields" genocide – which claimed the lives of up to 2million people – claim soldiers drank wine infused with human organs. 
One former captive reportedly revealed: "Whenever there were killings the guards would drink wine with a gall bladder. 
"I could see gall bladders drying in the sun and I knew these were from human beings." 
Henchmen are said to have believed the stomach-churning practice would transfer their enemy's power and "boost their courage" to carry out further bloodshed. 
Cannibalism was said to be rampant during the 60s and 70s and anyone caught indulging now faces execution. 
DAVE PLAYPENZ / FACEBOOK CURIOSITY: Dave Playpenz ate his finger after losing it in a motorbike accident 
COLCHESTER, ENGLAND 
Punk rocker Dave Playpenz hit the headlines when he cooked and ate his own finger after losing it in a motorbike accident. 
Dave decided to boil his digit in salt water after it was amputated by docs in a bid to satisfy his curiosity about the taste of human flesh. 
He revealed: "I'd always wondered what human flesh tastes like, but it's taboo. 
"People can't go round being cannibals, it's illegal. 
"Only then, it occurred to me that no one could haul me to court for eating my own flesh." 
And he kept the bones as a souvenir. 
Dave told love it! magazine: "I decided not to fry or roast the finger as that would damage (the bones). 
"I didn't have a sauce or drink wine with it as I wanted to know what the real taste was." 
Thankfully it does not appear to be a widespread practice across Britain. Related articles
